items.title: Request: Custom Sidebar View to Replace Copilot Chat
items.body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
Hello GitHub Copilot Chat team and community,

Thank you for your amazing work on this open-source project! I’m excited to explore customization options and have a specific use case to propose.

### Background
I’d like to create a custom sidebar view in VS Code to replace the default Copilot Chat sidebar with my own chat plugin. The goal is to integrate a custom AI service and provide a similar user experience (e.g., chat interface, code context support) while disabling or overriding the default Copilot Chat view.

### What I’ve Tried
- I’ve explored the VS Code Extension API and experimented with `registerWebviewViewProvider` to create a custom sidebar view.
- I can manually disable the Copilot Chat extension, but I’m unsure how to fully override its sidebar position or integrate my custom view seamlessly.
- I’ve reviewed the [vscode-copilot-chat](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-chat) repository and noticed the Webview-based implementation, but I need guidance on extending or replacing it.
- I searched existing Issues (0 open, 2 closed) and found no similar requests as of 07:24 AM HKT, July 26, 2025.

### Questions
1. Is it possible to programmatically replace the default Copilot Chat sidebar with a custom view using the VS Code API?
2. Are there recommended approaches or examples for overriding the sidebar layout or integrating a custom chat plugin?
3. Would contributing a new feature (e.g., a configuration to switch chat providers) be a viable way to achieve this, and how should I start?

### Additional Info
- VS Code version: 1.97.2
- I’m willing to share my progress, provide code samples, or test suggested solutions.

Looking forward to your insights! Thank you!

Best,
John

items.title: Auto Complete
items.body:
Type: Bug Every time I add any new var or block, autocomplete runs, then if I press ESC to cancel the suggestion, the next time I do almost anything, it trys to complete again. It's way to often and agressive. items.title: feature request: support Docker Model Runner as a provider for local models
items.body: It would be great if Copilot chat would allow to use Docker Model Runner to use locally running models in a similar way Ollama is supported in the BYOK area.

items.title: selected self-configured model is not always the one that is actually used
items.body:
I have four different models pulled via Ollama:

```
ollama list

NAME                ID              SIZE      MODIFIED       
phi4-mini:latest    78fad5d182a7    2.5 GB    33 seconds ago    
qwen3:8b            500a1f067a9f    5.2 GB    28 hours ago      
qwen3:4b            2bfd38a7daaf    2.6 GB    28 hours ago      
phi4:latest         ac896e5b8b34    9.1 GB    28 hours ago  
```

I select all of them via the `manage models` command and most of them show up in the chat agent model choice dropdown. Now I select one of them and try something in the chat. That works and the model is used.

Then, I disable the model via the `manage models` command palette. The chat agent box still shows it as the chosen model in the UI. When trying something into the chat and submit that, Copilot chat submits the prompt, but it seems to fall back to its previously selected or standard model, even though the UI still shows the Ollama model that I de-activated - which is a bit confusing and might make users think they are using a specific model when they are actually not.

items.title: cannot enter new key when existing one is broken
items.body:
I entered a wrong key when trying to manage models, but now this wrong key seems to be persisted somewhere and I can't enter a different one anymore. In the "manage models" quick pick, when selecting `OpenAI`, I immediately get the error message:

```
Incorrect API key provided: <the-wrong-key-that-I-typed-in>. You can find your API key at https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys.
```

items.title: Expect scrollbar in commit message input box

labels.name: under-discussion
labels.description: Issue is under discussion for relevance, priority, approach

items.body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
I'm using the latest VS Code Insiders and Copilot Chat pre-release on Windows.

I used the sparkle icon to generate a commit message, which worked well. Though since the generated commit message was quite long, it requires scrolling:
- I don't know how long the message is, since there is no scrollbar
- I tried using the sparkle emoji again to see if it'd override the existing message, and I planned to measure this by seeing if the length to scroll increased or decreased (but I can't do that today)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/95a46845-5b15-43fb-a993-31a044b35862)

items.title: Tab order not working as expected in Copilot Chat for chat responses

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: accessibility
labels.description: Keyboard, mouse, ARIA, vision, screen readers (non-specific) issues

items.body:
Type: Bug After focusing on the latest chat message in Copilot Chat, pressing Tab sends focus to the top of the chat list instead of to interactive elements within the current message (like references or code blocks). **Steps to Reproduce:** 1. Ask a question in Copilot Chat that results in a response with a code block. 2. Press `Control + Up Arrow` to move focus to the latest chat message (the response). 3. Press `Tab`. **Expected Behavior:** Tab should move focus to interactive elements inside the focused message (such as the references area, then the code block). **Actual Behavior:** Pressing Tab moves focus to the top of the chat, then continues through messages from the beginning, instead of staying within the current message. @meganrogge Extension version: 0.30.2025072401 VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.103.0-insider (d7ac7f7c61a2cc07dd8adc4a7146023131314d9a, 2025-07-24T05:04:03.203Z) OS version: Windows_NT arm64 10.0.26100 Modes:

items.title: Chat: Editing a past message doesn't reliably undo edits from that session
items.body: Steps to Reproduce: 1. Prompt agent to edit a few files 2. Edit last prompt 3. 🐛 Prior edits are not always reverted, causing more bad edits Even after Undo, the Keep comes back as ghost.

items.title: [NuGet MCP] Complete the NuGet MCP experiment and clean up the experiment code
items.body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

With https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/257463, the NuGet MCP flow is behind a feature flag (experiment). This issue tracks the handling of that experiment and rolling out the feature to all users.

I think there are two blockers:
- Bug: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/257675
- Enhancement: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/257679

Once these are resolved, we can dial up the experiment to all users, and then remove the experiment code (perhaps making it always on like npm, Python, and Docker).

items.title: [NuGet MCP] Use the server.json inside the .nupkg if available instead of the README (AI-assisted MCP)
items.body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

NuGet MCP server packages contain a `.mcp/server.json` file in the artifact. This can be used to further enhance the AI-assisted workflow for MCP server installation, since more context is available.

npm, Python, and Docker use an AI loop to get the MCP client configuration from the README. NuGet does this too, but could be even better by using the server.json, if present.

Suggested workflow:

1. Search for the package on NuGet.org as we do today: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-chat/blob/d755e97b1e7dbd389eb87ccda5479d089cf37715/src/extension/mcp/vscode-node/commands.ts#L208-L257
2. If the package as an `McpServer` package type, and after the user says "yes" to the install prompt, install the tool to a temporary directory using `dotnet tool install --tool-path`.
3. Look in this temp directory for the .mcp/server.json
4. If found, use the [`IMcpServerManifest`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/a9448f7ccaf079df46389f792c88b7ca8c9fdf23/src/vs/platform/mcp/common/mcpManagement.ts#L94-L97) and associated mapping code to reliably construct a client MCP configuration JSON.
   - I think this code needs to become accessible to the Copilot extension, perhaps by lifting some function or types to `index.d.ts`?
5. Clean up the temporary directory

This flow will "prime" the NuGet package cache so the subsequent `dnx` execution is very fast.

Using the server.json info which is better than guessing from the README.

The NuGet-specific code here should be moved out into its own module since it will get bigger.
https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-chat/blob/d755e97b1e7dbd389eb87ccda5479d089cf37715/src/extension/mcp/vscode-node/commands.ts#L208-L257

Open questions:
- How should the server.json to mcp.json mapping code be made available to the Copilot extension?
- What is the recommended way to run shell commands (`dotnet tool install`) in the background, with a temp directory, and reliable cleanup?
- Should the server.json handling still use the LLM tool calling loop? I think no, since this can be more like a future MCP Registry acquisition flow using a server.json instead of needing AI to handle schema-less README.md.

items.title: Make agent talk less about tools they need to activate
items.body: I'd prefer if the agent just activates tools and not talks about the implementation details of virtual tools. It is also confusing because I didn't _disable_ anything; and the agent enabling tools I might have disabled can even sound scary. Ideas: - Adapt the prompt to not announce the tool call or think out loud - Reword to less enable/activate, but sth like "retrieve" or "discover"

items.title: Virtual Tools should not disable mentioned tools
items.body: Steps to Reproduce: 1. Mention a tool group with a github tool, like notifications 2. 🐛 Needs to be activated first by the agent

items.title: Terminal suggest: Provider descriptions should show up when configuring the provider

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

items.body: Providers should include a description, that will let us describe what they do here: We want this as part of the API stabilization.

items.title: Chat: Try Again requests are adding up in the conversation
items.body:
I'd expect hitting the _Try Again_ to be not visible to the AI; as it doesn't get context of what failed and could not use a "try again" prompt to reason what happened.

This session hit a large image response in a tool:

```
### User
~~~md
<context>
The current date is July 23, 2025.
</context>
<reminderInstructions>

</reminderInstructions>
<userRequest>
Try Again
</userRequest>
~~~

### User
~~~md
<context>
The current date is July 23, 2025.
</context>
<reminderInstructions>

</reminderInstructions>
<userRequest>
Try Again
</userRequest>
~~~

### User
~~~md
<context>
The current date is July 23, 2025.
</context>
<reminderInstructions>

</reminderInstructions>
<userRequest>
Try Again
</userRequest>
~~~

### User
~~~md
<context>
The current date is July 23, 2025.
</context>
<reminderInstructions>

</reminderInstructions>
<userRequest>
Try Again
</userRequest>
~~~
```

items.title: Chat: Virtual tools can lead to duplicated `activate` groups
Chat: Kept files are reset when switching back and forth via conversation history
items.body:
STR:
1. Do an editing flow in the agent mode
2. Keep all the files
3. Switch to another conversation via history
4. Switch back
5. 🐛 All files are in changed state again.

items.title: Provide way to disable built-in templates in `Snippets: Fill File with Snippet`
items.body: In a brand new install of VSCode with no extensions, if you execute `Snippets: Fill File with Snippet` from the command palette on a new blank document it will provide the following menu options for HTML / JS / JSX / etc file templates (snippets): As far as I am aware it is not possible to disable / remove these suggestions. This is a request to provide an option to disable these built-in file template snippets. It is also currently impossible AFAIK to re-organize this list, meaning that user created snippets could be several items down as it seems to be sorted by language name.

Wir müssen sicherstellen, dass im Ziel js Dateien ankommen, auch wenn in der Quelle ts liegen. { "name": "chatbot-projekt", "version": "1.0.0", "description": "ChatBot Projekt mit TypeScript Komponenten", "type": "module", "scripts": { "clean:dist": "rimraf dist", "clean:web": "rimraf _web", "build:ts": "tsc", "copy:assets": "npx cpx2 \"src/**/*.{html,css,js,json}\" dist && npx cpx2 \"src/assets/**/*\" dist/assets", "build:dist": "npm run clean:dist && npm run build:ts && npm run copy:assets", "deploy:_tealchat": "npx cpx2 \"dist/**/*.{js,css,html,ico}\" _web/_tealchat && npx items.title: Git Graph should support reset, soft reset and maybe squashing through the context menu

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

items.body: Hey guys, the git graph is super helpful to get an quick overview over the history of the current project. Right now I can easily cherry pick commits from one branch into another. I am missing some handy tools for tidying up my feature branch, before I push it to the remote. I'd like to click onto a specific commit and then (soft) reset my branch to that commit, or if I could select multiple commits and squash them into one. I think you could put them into the context menu of a specific commit. Right now I am using the extension "Git History" for those operations (https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=donjayamanne.githistory). Thanks in advance

items.title: Drag & Drop to Reorder Members in Outline Panel
items.body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
Hi VS Code team,

I would like to request a feature for the Explorer’s Outline panel:  
the ability to drag and drop functions, types, or other code members to reorder them directly within a file.

**Motivation**
- This would make it much easier to refactor and organize code, especially in large files.
- Currently, the Outline panel only supports navigation. Reordering requires manual cut-and-paste, which is error-prone and less efficient.
- Many developers would benefit from a more visual and interactive way to manage code structure.

**Suggested Behavior**
- Allow users to drag a function/type/member in the Outline panel and drop it to a new position.
- The editor should automatically move the corresponding code block in the file.
- Optionally, provide a preview or undo option for the change.

Thank you for considering this feature!

Related previous discussion: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/68353
